fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article (UK’s largest solar farm poised to begin development in Kent, 25 May, page 32) said that Cleve Hill solar farm had won the support of the Planning Inspectorate earlier this month. However, the inspectorate’s recommendations are not known. • Homophone corner: “… the kind of people who would swap you a jar of jam for an emerald broach in the middle of a siege” (Corner shops are reflecting the best and worst of us, 25 May, page 3, G2). • Other recently amended articles include: Text message tells vulnerable people they are dropped from shielding list No changing rooms: what to expect when non-essential shops reopen Steve Bell on Dominic Cummings’ press conference — cartoon ‘It’s outrageous’: inside an infuriating Netflix series on Jeffrey Epstein Canada: neglected residents and rotten food found at care homes hit by Covid-19 ‘Incalculable loss’: New York Times covers front page with 1,000 Covid-19 death notices Covid-19 got rough sleepers off England’s streets. The question is what happens next ‘We’ve never seen this’: wildlife thrives in closed US national parks Rio Tinto blasts 46,000-year-old Aboriginal site to expand iron ore mine
